ldc_extent.charseq: They said 52-year-old Jason Shane of Pryor and his wife, Tana Shane, who is estimated to be in her late 40’s or early 50’s, both lost their lives when they were shot Wednesday morning shortly after 10 a.m.
A nephew of the Shanes said the couple spotted a man stranded along the side of the road in his car.
A nephew of the Shanes said the couple spotted a man stranded along the side of the road in his car.
They stopped and took him to a store that’s located about a quarter of a mile away for gasoline.
When they returned him to his green Ford Taurus with plates out of Washakie County, Wyo., family members said the man shot the couple.
He also shot a third passenger, the couple's 25-year-old daughter who fortunately got away and got help from staff at the nearby St. Charles Indian Mission School.
The Park County Wyoming Sheriff's Office confirmed the suspect was taken into custody without incident around 12:30 p.m. Wednesday more than 150 miles away from the scene in Meeteetse, Wyo.
The Park County Wyoming Sheriff's Office confirmed the suspect was taken into custody without incident around 12:30 p.m. Wednesday more than 150 miles away from the scene in Meeteetse, Wyo.
He was driving a silver 2006 Pontiac G6, which family members of the Shanes said belonged to the victims.
He was driving a silver 2006 Pontiac G6, which family members of the Shanes said belonged to the victims.
Because the suspect was considered armed and dangerous at the time, the deputy did not conduct a stop, and waited for backup from a trooper with the Wyoming Highway Patrol.
Park County Public Affairs Officer Lance Mathess said the suspect is being held in the county detention center in “investigatory custody for another agency.”

ldc_extent.charseq: With assistance from the Big Horn County Sheriff's Office and the Montana Highway Patrol at the crime scene, the investigation will be lead by the FBI and Bureau of Indian Affairs.

extent.charseq: On Wednesday afternoon about 40 miles south of Billings, the usually desolate Pryor Gap Road was filled with emotion as loved ones mourned the loss of two family members.

They said 52-year-old Jason Shane of Pryor and his wife, Tana Shane, who is estimated to be in her late 40’s or early 50’s, both lost their lives when they were shot Wednesday morning shortly after 10 a.m.
When they returned him to his green Ford Taurus with plates out of Washakie County, Wyo., family members said the man shot the couple.
He also shot a third passenger, the couple's 25-year-old daughter who fortunately got away and got help from staff at the nearby St. Charles Indian Mission School.
The woman suffered a bullet wound to her head and lower back and was taken to a Billings hospital, family members said.
The Taurus the suspect was reportedly driving remained at the investigation scene behind police tape Wednesday afternoon.
The Park County Wyoming Sheriff's Office confirmed the suspect was taken into custody without incident around 12:30 p.m. Wednesday more than 150 miles away from the scene in Meeteetse, Wyo.
The suspect was first spotted by a Park County Sheriff’s Deputy driving southbound on Highway 120 at 11:49 p.m.
After following the suspect for 12 miles, he was stopped and taken into custody along County Road 3LE, which is commonly referred to as the Burlington cut across.
Following the arrest of the suspect, the FBI said there is no further danger to the community.
Related: Shooting confirmed in Pryor; Suspect in custody
